title: Setting quarkus.opentelemetry.tracer.sampler to 'off' as stated in the docs crashes the application on startup
body:
### Describe the bug

The documentations states: 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1176370/216039499-8d7eb959-57ee-4efd-8145-0e072fb59c3e.png)

If I configure it like this, the application fails with an exception though: 
```

"%test":
  quarkus:
    opentelemetry:
      tracer:
        exporter:
          otlp:
            endpoint: http://traces.grafana-agent.svc.cluster.local:55680
        sampler: off
```
Stacktrace: 
```
java.lang.RuntimeException: Failed to start quarkus

Caused by: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Unrecognized value for sampler: false
	at io.quarkus.opentelemetry.runtime.tracing.TracerUtil.getBaseSampler(TracerUtil.java:38)
	at io.quarkus.opentelemetry.runtime.tracing.TracerUtil.mapSampler(TracerUtil.java:54)

	at io.quarkus.deployment.steps.TracerProcessor$setupTracer738683979.deploy(Unknown Source)
	... 68 more
```

### Expected behavior

quarkus should start

### Actual behavior

quarkus does not start

### How to Reproduce?

Reproducer: 

1.) Clone https://github.com/u6f6o/quarkus-tracing-sampler-config-bug
2.) Execute the GreetingResourceTest test

### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

_No response_

### Output of `java -version`

_No response_

### GraalVM version (if different from Java)

_No response_

### Quarkus version or git rev

2.16.0.Final

### Build tool (ie. output of `mvnw --version` or `gradlew --version`)

_No response_

### Additional information

_No response_
